alert.note: Alert for Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 31 at 2:27PM CST until January 02 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 PM CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM SATURDAY TO NOON CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory in effect New Year`s Eve and New Year`s Day, dangerously cold wind chills around 20 to 25 below zero are expected. For the Wind Chill Advisory occurring Saturday night through Sunday morning, dangerously cold wind chills are expected reaching down to around 25 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from midnight tonight to 6 PM CST Saturday. The Wind Chill Advisory for New Year`s Eve/New Year`s Day will be in effect from midnight tonight to noon CST Saturday. The Wind Chill Advisory for Saturday night/Sunday morning will be in effect from 6 PM Saturday to noon CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow is expected to significantly reduce visibility at times. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very cold wind chills could be dangerous for vulnerable populations and livestock. If traveling for the holiday make sure to take proper precautions if an emergency occurs. Wind chills Sunday morning may be colder than 25 below zero in localized areas.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
